Title:
Morphological and phylogenetic characterization of novel
Cytospora species and new record of C. rhizophorae associated with
mangroves
Keywords:
Cytosporaceae, Lumnitzera racemosa, Mangoves, Phylogeny,
Taxonomy, Xylocarpus granarum, Xylocarpus moluccensis
Abstract:
Mangroves are suitable habitats harboring a number of
novel species of fungi. In this study, samples of microfungi were
collected from symptomatic branches, stem and leaves of different
mangrove species (Xylocarpus granarum, X. moluccensis and Lumnitzera
racemosa) and examined morphologically. In addition, a combined
multi-gene DNA sequence dataset (ITS, LSU, ACT and RPB2) was analysed to
investigate phylogenetic relationships and help in a more reliable
species identification. Two new species, Cytospora thailandica sp. nov.
and C. lumnitzericola sp. nov. are introduced herein, while one specimen
of C. rhizophorae is described and designated as a reference specimen.
The phylogeny recovered supports our morphological data to introduce two
new species to the genus Cytospora.
